This is to Certify that on the 6th day of April, 1957
Barry Rexford Mosher was initiated a Brother in the
Zeta Psi Fraternity
and as such is entitled to all the privileges and immunities
of the same
ΖΨ
DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY
Reserve Officers’ Training Corps
The Title of
DISTINGUISHED MILITARY GRADUATE
Is Awarded To
BARRY REXFORD MOSHER of RENSSELAER POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE, TROY, NEW YORK
For
displaying outstanding qualities of leadership, high moral character,
noteworthy academic achievement, and exceptional
aptitude for military service
headquarters, FIRST united states army, GOVERNORS ISLAND, NEW YORK 4, NEW YORK
this 5th day of JUNE 19 59
B. M. BRYAN, LIEUTENANT GENERAL, USA
COMMANDING
Army Security Agency School
Certificate
This is to certify that
SECOND LIEUTENANT BARRY R. MOSHER
has satisfactorily completed the course of instruction in
and
is hereby declared a graduate of the
US ARMY SECURITY AGENCY INSTRUCTOR TRAINING COURSE
given at Fort Devens, Massachusetts, this 4th day of September 1959
the
PRESIDENT
of
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
To all who shall see these presents, greeting:
Know Ye, that reposing special trust and confidence in the patriotism, valor, fidelity
and abilities of Barry Rexford Mosher, I do
appoint him a Reserve Commissioned Officer in the
grade of Second Lieutenant
in the
Army of the United States
to date as such from the fifth day of June, nineteen
hundred and fifty‐nine. This Officer will therefore carefully and diligently
discharge the duties of the office to which appointed by doing and performing all
manner of things thereunto belonging.
And I do strictly charge and require those Officers and other personnel of lesser
rank to render such obedience as is due an officer of this grade and position. And
this Officer to observe and follow such orders and directions, from time to time, as
may be given by me, or the future President of the United States of America, or other
Superior Officers acting in accordance with the laws of the United States of America.
This commission is to continue in force during the pleasure of the President of
the United States of America, for the time being, under the provisions of those Public
Laws relating to Officers of the Armed Forces of the United States of America
and the component thereof in which this appointment is made.
Done at the City of Washington, this fifth day of June,
in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and fifty‐nine, and of the
Independence of the United States of America the one hundred and eighty‐third
